ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Linux - F90 really required?  --NO-- python example works fine on generic redhat linux
ygData.msgSnippet: Responding to my own message -- sorry -- Cantera/Python works fine without F90 compiler. ... I built cantera on a generic Red Hat Linux release 7.3 (Valhalla)

Responding to my own message -- sorry -- 

Cantera/Python works fine without F90 compiler.


> >
> > My main work is done on a linux machine.
> >
> > I am considering switching from Chemkin II to cantera but don't
> > have a Fortran-90 compiler.
> >
> > The manual is not really explicit about what functionality will
> > be unavailable without  F90 compiler.
> > I would be happy to program completely in C++/python  if
> > that's a reasonable option.
> >
> > If F90 is really required, there seem to be many choices.
> > Intel has a fullfeatured eval download, and there are others --
> > any advice?


I built cantera on a generic Red Hat Linux release 7.3 (Valhalla)  with
no problems ( a few little stumbles; eg, python/python2, exporting envirnonments, etc)

The flame1 demo ran fine.  I imported the  csv file into gnumeric to plot it.

I suggest modifying the FAQ to make it clear that cantera can be built and run
using only GPL or other free tools.  I held off trying cantera for months  -- 
until I was desperate - due to concern over this point.

Dave G tells me he is about to release more info RE Cantera/g77 soon.

Looks like a really useful package!
					Steve
